clinical_study.brief_title: McGrath Series 5 Videolaryngoscope for Double-lumen Tube Intubation
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation McGrath Series 5 Videolaryngoscope for Double-lumen Tube Intubation

lead_sponsor.agency: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock:
1. Double-lumen tube intubation is difficult, compared with single lume tube.
2. McGrath Series 5 videolaryngoscope hase been used in difficult airway management, both in anesthetized and awake patients.
3. But there was little information about McGrath Series 5 videolaryngoscope for double-lumen tube intubation.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, the purpose was to evaluate the success rate and intubation time of McGrath Series 5 videolaryngoscope for double-lumen tube intubation in patients without predictors of difficult intubation.

primary_outcome.description: defined as time from inserting blade to mouth to three cycles on capnograph

secondary_outcome.measure: number of successful intubation at first attempt

other_outcome.description: based on the modified Mallampati classification. degree 1 to 4
based on Cormack-Lehane classification. degree 1 to 4

arm_group.description: The patients received videolaryngoscope for double-lumen tube intubation

intervention.description: McGrath Series 5 videolaryngoscope is one kind of portable videolaryngoscopes, which has been usde in both unexpected and anticipated difficult intubation.

study_pop.textblock: adult patients scheduled for thoracic surgery requiring double-lumen tube insertion for one-lung ventilation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients
- thoracic surgery
- ASA classification 1-3
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergent operation
- predicted difficult airway
- difficult ventilation
- limited mouth opening
